page.title: 17ECOLOGY IN THE STUDY AREA
page.content: Many summer migrants nest in the study area,these include swallows,swifts,and house martins,wood and willow warbler, and chiff chaff.The two most abundant winter migrants are the redwing and fieldfare. The once rare collared dove is now reaching pest proportions , by feeding on spilt grain in the farmyards. Although meadow flowers are declining in numbers due to ploughing and reseeding, the hedgerow flowers remain common, these include :-ox-eyed daisy, vetch, fox gloves, red campion, herb Robert, hedge bindweed, and greater stitchwort, with lady's smock, in the wetter areas, and rosebay willow herb in the disturbed areas.
